articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN and BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israel said Saturday that it killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, dealing its most significant blow to the Lebanese militant group after months of fighting.
articles.title: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed in Beirut strike, Israel's military says

articles.author: STEPHEN SMITH, KATE PAYNE and HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: PERRY, Fla. (AP) — Hurricane Helene caused dozens of deaths and billions of dollars of destruction across a wide swath of the southeastern U.S.
articles.title: Dozens dead and millions without power after Helene's deadly march across southeastern US

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Smoke rose from Beirut’s southern suburbs Saturday morning and the streets were empty after the area was pummeled overnight by heavy Israeli airstrikes that it said killed multiple Hezbollah commanders, including leader Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Israel-Hamas war latest: Israel says it killed Hezbollah's leader in airstrike on Beirut

articles.author: EDITH M. LEDERER
articles.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — European, Arab and Islamic nations have launched an initiative to strengthen support for a Palestinian state and its institutions, and prepare for a future after the war in Gaza and escalating conflict in Lebanon, Norway’s foreign minister said Friday.
articles.title: Europeans, Arab and Muslim nations launch a new initiative for an independent Palestinian state

articles.author: TODD RICHMOND
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A day after Vice President Kamala Harris discussed immigration at the U.S.-Mexico border, former President Donald Trump is expected to respond by again linking her to illegal border crossings at an event in a western Wisconsin river town.
articles.title: Trump is set to respond to Harris on immigration during his visit to a small Wisconsin town

articles.author: DIDI TANG and DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — When veteran U.S. diplomat Kurt Campbell traveled to the Solomon Islands to counter Beijing's influence in the South Pacific country, he quickly saw just how far China would go to spread its message.
articles.title: In global game of influence, China turns to a cheap and effective tool: fake news

articles.author: BY QASSIM ABDUL-ZAHRA and TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. announced an agreement with the Iraqi government Friday to wrap up the military mission in Iraq of an American-led coalition fighting the Islamic State group by next year, with U.S.
articles.title: Wrapping up mission, US troops will leave some longstanding bases in Iraq under new deal

articles.author: ANTHONY IZAGUIRRE
articles.description: For months, New York City Mayor Eric Adams — a former cop — refused to criticize the federal authorities investigating his administration. Not anymore.The day news of his indictment on corruption charges broke, Adams defiantly suggested, without providing evidence, that U.S.
articles.title: Indicted New York City mayor adopts familiar defense: He was targeted for his politics

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: Already the longest-lived of the 45 men to serve as U.S. president, Jimmy Carter is about to reach the century mark. The 39th president, who remains under home hospice care, will turn 100 on Tuesday, Oct.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter at 100: A century of changes for a president, the US and the world since 1924

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — “Saturday Night Live” is set to set off its 50th season with host Jean Smart and musical guest Jelly Roll.
articles.title: 'Saturday Night Live' launches 50th season with Jean Smart, Jelly Roll and maybe Maya as Kamala
